name: ThemeProvider
description: Theme provider for light/dark mode with automatic color inversion, localStorage persistence, and device preference detection. Integrates with UI Lab's semantic color system for automatic theme-aware styling.

hooks.name: useTheme
hooks.description: Access full theme context including mode, device preference, and manual overrides. Use this for reading current theme state and theme-related metadata.

returns.toggleThemeMode: () => void - Switch between light and dark modes
returns.setThemeMode: (mode: 'light' | 'dark') => void - Set theme to specific mode
returns.resetToDevicePreference: () => void - Revert to device OS preference

hooks.name: useThemeMode
hooks.description: Lightweight hook for theme mode only (light/dark). Use this when you only need the current mode, not the full context.

examples.title: Provider Setup
examples.description: Wrap your application root in ThemeProvider to enable theme support.

examples.title: Theme Toggle Component
examples.description: Create a simple toggle button to switch between light and dark modes.

examples.title: Advanced Patterns
examples.description: Programmatic control, conditional rendering, and View Transition API integration.

features.name: Automatic Color Inversion
features.description: Colors automatically invert between light and dark modes using shade pairing (50↔950, 100↔900, etc.)
features.details: No need for dark: prefixes or manual color overrides. The semantic color system handles all inversions transparently.

features.name: FOUC Prevention
features.description: Prevents Flash of Unstyled Content by loading theme preference before rendering.
features.details: Include the initialization script in your layout.tsx before the closing </body> tag to prevent theme flickering on page load.

features.name: localStorage Persistence
features.description: Theme preference persists across sessions using browser localStorage.
features.details: User's theme choice is automatically saved and restored on subsequent visits.

features.name: Device Preference Detection
features.description: Respects system OS theme preferences using prefers-color-scheme.
features.details: Automatically detects and applies device theme. User can override with manual selection.

features.name: View Transition API Integration
features.description: Smooth transitions between themes using CSS View Transitions.
features.details: Wrap toggleThemeMode() in startViewTransition() for animated theme changes in supported browsers.

integrationSteps: Wrap your app root in ThemeProvider at app/providers.tsx
Import and use providers in app/layout.tsx: <Providers>{children}</Providers>
Add FOUC prevention script to layout.tsx before closing </body> tag
Create ThemeToggle component using useTheme() hook
Place toggle in navigation or header for user access
bestPractices: Always wrap your entire app in ThemeProvider - place it at the root level before all other providers
Use useThemeMode for simple mode checks, useTheme for advanced features like device preference
Don't hardcode color hex values - use semantic Tailwind classes (text-foreground-50, bg-background-900, etc.)
No need for dark: prefixes in Tailwind - colors automatically adapt to the current theme
Initialize theme before first render to prevent FOUC - use the provided initialization script
Semantic colors automatically invert: 50↔950, 100↔900, 200↔800, 300↔700, 400↔600, 500 stays same
For smooth transitions, wrap toggleThemeMode in View Transition API: document.startViewTransition(() => toggleThemeMode())
Store theme preference in localStorage automatically - no manual storage needed
